definitions.definition: A starting or falling back; a rebound; a shrinking.
examples: the recoil of nature, or of the blood

definitions.definition: The state or condition of having recoiled.

The energy transmitted back to the shooter from a firearm which has fired. Recoil is a function of the weight of the weapon , the weight of the projectile , and the speed at which it leaves the muzzle .
An escapement in which, after each beat , the scape-wheel recoils slightly.

main_definition: A starting or falling back; a rebound; a shrinking.
secondary_definitions: The state or condition of having recoiled.

( firearms ) The energy transmitted back to the shooter from a firearm which has fired. Recoil is a function of the weight of the weapon , the weight of the projectile , and the speed at which it leaves the muzzle .
An escapement in which, after each beat , the scape-wheel recoils slightly.
